pt.ua.dicoogle.sdk

Interface StorageInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DicooglePlugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultFileStoragePlugin

    public interface StorageInterface
extends DicooglePlugin
    Storage plugin interface. These types of plugins provide an abstraction to reading and writing from files or data blobs.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getScheme

        java.lang.String getScheme()
        Gets the scheme URI of this storage plugin.
        Returns:
        a string denoting the scheme that this plugin associates to
        See Also:
        URI

      • handles

        @Deprecated
default boolean handles(java.net.URI location)
        Deprecated. 
        Checks whether the file in the given path can be handled by this storage plugin.
        Parameters:
        location - a URI containing a scheme to be verified
        Returns:
        true if this storage plugin is in charge of URIs in the given form

      • at

        java.lang.Iterable<StorageInputStream> at(java.net.URI location,
                                          java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Provides a means of iteration over all existing objects at a specified location, including those in sub-directories. This method is particularly nice for use in for-each loops. The provided scheme is not relevant at this point, but the developer must avoid calling this method with a path of a different schema. 
        for(StorageInputStream dicomObj : storagePlugin.at("file://dataset/")){
      System.err.println(dicomObj.getURI());
 }
        Parameters:
        location - the location to read
        parameters - a variable list of extra parameters for the retrieve
        Returns:
        an iterable of storage input streams
        See Also:
        StorageInputStream

      • store

        java.net.URI store(DicomObject dicomObject,
                   java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Stores a DICOM object into the storage.
        Parameters:
        dicomObject - Object to be Stored
        parameters - a variable list of extra parameters for the retrieve
        Returns:
        The URI of the previously stored Object.

      • store

        java.net.URI store(DicomInputStream inputStream,
                   java.lang.Object... parameters)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Stores a new element into the storage.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - an input stream with the contents to be stored
        parameters - a variable list of extra parameters for the retrieve
        Returns:
        the URI of the stored data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • remove

        void remove(java.net.URI location)
        Removes an element at the given URI.
        Parameters:
        location - the URI of the stored data

      • list

        default java.util.stream.Stream<java.net.URI> list(java.net.URI location)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Lists the elements at the given location in the storage's file tree. Unlike at(java.net.URI, java.lang.Object...), this method is not recursive and can yield intermediate URIs representing other directories rather than objects. The provided scheme is not relevant at this point, but the developer must avoid calling this method with a path of a different scheme.
        Parameters:
        location - the base storage location to list
        Returns:
        a standard stream of URIs representing entries in the given base location
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this storage does not support listing directories
        java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException - if the given location does not exist in the storage
        java.nio.file.NotDirectoryException - if the given location does not refer to a listable entry (a directory)
        java.io.IOException - if some other I/O error occurs
